description: From Middle French alluder, from Latin alludere (“to play with or allude”), from ad + ludere (“to play”).

verbs.description: allude (third-person singular simple present alludes, present participle alluding, simple past and past participle alluded)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To refer to something indirectly or by suggestion.
examples: These speeches . . . do seem to allude unto such ministerial garments as were then in use.
